document_title: Discoid lupus erythematosus: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
Cutaneous LE Disease Area and Severity Index (CLASI) was developed to classify the severity of cutaneous lupus erythematosus. The total score of the CLASI index is calculated on the basis of 12 anatomical locations, based on 2 parameters: activity score and total damage score. (3)
Total performance score is based on:
Degree of skin redness (0–3); Mucosal lesions (0–1); Current hair loss (0–1), intermittent hair loss (0–3)
Total injury score is based on:
Degree of skin pigmentation disorder (0–2). The condition of dyspigmentation lasting more than 12 months doubles the number of dyspigmentation points.; Skin scars (0-2), for scalp scars (0, 3, 4, 5, 6)
